The Chinese police say they have busted a counterfeiting ring that produced as many as a million fake Chanel and Louis Vuitton handbags. But phony goods (from medicines and books to Ray-Bans and Rolexes) continue to be openly sold in China, as wel...
abstract: The Chinese police say they have busted a counterfeiting ring that produced as many as a million fake Chanel and Louis Vuitton handbags. But phony goods (from medicines and books to Ray-Bans and Rolexes) continue to be openly sold in China, as well as in the three Southeast Asian cities being visited this week by President Obama - Bangkok, Yangon and Phnom Penh.

headline.main: All Along Obama's Itinerary, Notorious Markets Persist

snippet: A city that has modernized rapidly over the past 10 years now faces whispers of violence, tremors of economic downturn and calls by a local strongman to rearm against the Taliban.
abstract: Herat Journal; Herat, Afghanistan, city that has modernized rapidly over past 10 years, now faces fears of encroaching violence in wake of coming American pullout; city also is confronting indications of economic downturn, calls by local strongman to rearm against Taliban, and conservative opposition to modernization.

headline.main: Freewheeling Afghan City Fearful of U.S. Pullout
headline.print_headline: Freewheeling Afghan City Fearful of U.S. Pullout

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

snippet: With potential changes in the tax code set to take place on Jan. 1, investors and business owners have begun to protect their income before the end of the year.
abstract: Business owners and investors are rapidly maneuvering to shield themselves from the prospect of higher taxes in 2013, strategy that is sending ripples across Wall Street and broad areas of the economy; overriding goal of wealthy is to record as much future income this year as possible through moves as diverse as sales of businesses, one-time dividends and the sale of stocks that have been big winners.

headline.main: Investors Rush to Beat Threat of Higher Taxes
headline.print_headline: Investors Rush To Beat Threat Of Higher Taxes

byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

snippet: Being in the Billion-Dollar Club limits how, and if, a start-up can get out. For one thing, when you’re the most expensive product on the shelf, very few companies can afford to buy you.
abstract: Being in the Billion-Dollar Club limits how, and if, a start-up can get out. For one thing, when you’re the most expensive product on the shelf, very few companies can afford to buy you.

headline.main: Disruptions: A $1 Billion Start-Up Might Not Be So Fun
headline.print_headline: Limits for Start-Ups After Billion-Dollar Mark

snippet: App developers have turned cellphones and tablets into powerful tools, spawning a multibillion-dollar industry but making huge sacrifices in the process.

headline.main: As Boom Lures App Creators, Tough Part Is Making a Living
headline.print_headline: As Boom Lures App Creators, Tough Part Is Making a Living

snippet: Books on Emma Goldman and Alexander Berkman; the jazz guitarist John Pizzarelli; and the ecology of New York Harbor.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Sasha and Emma: The Anarchist Odyssey of Alexander Berkman and Emman Goldman by Paul and Karen Avrich, World on a String: A Musical Memoir by John Pizzarelli, Heartbeats in the Muck:The History, Sea Life and Environment of New York Harbor by John Waldman and Still the Same Hawk: Reflections on Nature and New York, edited by Waldman.

snippet: Six Main’s chef offers distinctive and exciting creations like raw jicama ravioli, cabbage-wrapped mole enchilada and a smoky beet burger.
abstract: Stephanie Lyness reviews Six Main Restaurant in Chester (Metropolitan/Connecticut).

headline.main: Artistry at Work in a Vegan Menu
headline.print_headline: Artistry at Work In a Vegan Menu

snippet: The same wines go with both centerpieces of the traditional Thanksgiving dinner, with a sparkling rosé or chardonnay to start.
abstract: Howard G Goldberg Long Island Vines column describes wines he plans to pair with Thanksgiving dinner (Metropolitan/Long Island).

snippet: Designed by the star architect Jean Nouvel, this property delivers good value outside the city center.
abstract: Emily Brennan reviews Courtyard by Marriott Montpellier hotel in Montpellier, France.

headline.main: Hotel Review: Courtyard by Marriott in Montpellier, France
headline.print_headline: Montpellier, France: Courtyard by Marriott  Montpellier
